name: api_reverse_engineering
description: Intercept and extract data from internal APIs

args: import requests; response = requests.get('https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/posts/1'); data = response.json(); print('API Response:'); print(f'  ID: {data["id"]}'); print(f'  Title: {data["title"]}'); print(f'  Body length: {len(data["body"])} chars')

expected_output.example:
API Response:
  ID: 1
  Title: sunt aut facere...
  Body length: 100+ chars

Direct API access

args: import requests; headers = {'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0', 'Accept': 'application/json'}; response = requests.get('https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/users', headers=headers); users = response.json(); print(f'Users: {len(users)}'); [print(f'  {u["name"]} - {u["email"]}') for u in users[:3]]

expected_output.example:
Users: 10
  Leanne Graham - Sincere@april.biz
  Ervin Howell - Shanna@melissa.tv
  Clementine Bauch - Nathan@yesenia.net

API data with custom headers

args: import requests; import json; session = requests.Session(); session.headers.update({'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0'}); response = session.get('https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/posts?userId=1'); posts = response.json(); print(f'User posts: {len(posts)}'); print(f'First post: {posts[0]["title"][:40]}...')

expected_output.example:
User posts: 10
First post: sunt aut facere repellat provident...

API with query parameters
